job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: great training, and great community
cons: long hours, and lots of overtime

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Worked with some very smart and friendly EMTs, lots of them are college students, it’s easy to make friends. You have some good conversations on those long drives while doing transfers. You also see some sick and potentially dying hospice patients and e get good practice with taking vitals, preforming a basic assessment and asking questions.
cons: You do IFT 95% of the time but you also have to respond to 9-1-1 calls when they don’t have ALS coverage available. Back then I wasn’t comfortable responding to 9-1-1 calls because I rarely did so. The pay is also fairly low compared to the amount that IFT EMTs are paid out on the east coast.

pros: Decent pay, high call volume, good benefits
cons: Management, Environment, Opportunities for advancement.

pros: love to work at hva. people are great, work is great, everything is great. no issues 5 out of 5. never had any problems.
cons: no cons, best job ever

pros: Supervisors are great at HVA.
cons: pay is a bit low

pros: Well-kept trucks and equipment, new power cots, decent benefits, higher standards for many aspects of the job, genuinely nice co-workers so far, call volume is not bad for BLS IFT; 3-4 calls for 10 hour unit, 4-5 calls for 12 hour unit, on average. Not frequently held over more than 15 mins. Sometimes get to go home early  (using PTO) if you happen to get a partner working half a shift with no replacement, always nice when that happens. Premium for working nights (past 5pm I think is when that starts). Great place to start getting experience, and their education department is good too.  Great medics to learn from. My experience with supervisors has been positive, no complaints there.
cons:
BLS is 98% IFT and a priority call is rare, gotta be a cleared Basic to work ALS for 911 experience if that's what you are after. Full-Time is considered 48 or 50 hours a week; work/life balance isn't great but that's EMS for ya I suppose, although I've seen a company up north that considered 36 hrs full time for benefits and the pay was slightly better. 
Logis/Dispatch likes to give out calls without regard to the time it takes for end of shift duties, but that's a common complaint in EMS. 
Overall not that many cons I've experienced.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Easy, interesting, exciting, opportunity, advancement
cons: Politics, big company, education department

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: I love the relationships that I have been able to build with my co workers. We have so much fun together and we are always able to joke around and laugh. I consider us to be a team and we get along very well. We have our problems just like anyone else but at the end of the day we are a family. This is the best company I have ever worked for. The management can be a bit much at times but overall I love working here.
cons: My particular position can be a bit tedious at times because of the callers. I also don't like that there's not really any room for growth because I would love to be here for years.

pros: co-workers, equipment, continue education, unlimited amounts of overtime, health care, job security excellent training program, profit sharing
cons: micro managed by very high ups, unlimited overtime, sitting point(being moved from assigned area to another for coverage) low moral, not enough employees to have all of the shifts covered, vacations and pto, can only be 2 people off per day through out the entire company, and does not go by seniority, non union

review_title: If your choose EMS as a career. This is one of the best in the state.
pros: Decent pay, fair management, good benefits, full time and part time positions avaliable. Large market to work in. Shift bids happen often.
cons: Hours can be brutal. You take a pay cut for working 24 hours shifts because you "can sleep at night" Let me tell you that's a rouse. You will not sleep much, if any on 24 hour cars.

pros: I’ve worked EMS in 3 states for a few companies. This one has all of its ducks in a row, mostly. Very organized. Good equipment, fair wages, good benefits, ample training opportunities.
cons: Busy system. Lots of posting and movement. Can be stuck in a lot of areas you are unfamiliar with at first. Dispatch has a hard job seeing how busy they are, but there are things they could do better (nursing home calls are sometimes vague on their end, for instance).

review_title: Beware of flexible-part-time and part-time positions with this company.
pros: Part timers get paid on a 17 to 20 hour work week scale but if you clock more than 30 per week. Rest of what you earned is paid out on the following pay period.
cons: Bio metric reader has an 8 minute delay so you must clock in 15 to 30 minutes early to show an on time because management will place on performance improvement program and resolve the delayed clock in issues that you would have from clocking in or punching out.

review_title: awful top management, short-staffed and getting PTSD
pros: decent wage, good holiday pay
cons: dispatchers get anxiety disorders and PTSD, top management is dishonest, also loses contracts due to incompetence, keeps us short-staffed AND taking non-emergency calls about stuff like potholes

review_title: I wish things could have been different.
job_title: Wheelchair Van Driver in Plymouth, MI
pros: Pleasant work environment, kind clients and co workers, flexible schedule making, management is competent and casual.
cons: Long hours, chance of being held over.  Shift start time is subject to change and shift duties can vary.

review_title: Great pay $15-$25/hour,  HSA of $1500/year, BCBS vision/dental ppo, strict, busy, and unpredictable leadership.
pros: Pay, benefits. Some good people.
cons: Junior Paramedic shifts are terrible. 3 week cycle. 3 24hr shifts for 2 weeks and 1 week with 2 24s or  4 12s.

pros: co-workers, equipment, and involvement with medical control
cons: high up management, politics, uniforms, outdated company policies

pros: Great new employee training program, Great people, great education department, good company structure.
cons: 24 hour cars make less per hour then 12 hour cars.

pros: Great equipment, good pay, good benefits at a decent rate, Good coworkers, plenty of rescue to be had.
cons: Busy system but thats what to expect with this career
